items.title: F&O Radar | Deploy Bull Call Spread in Nifty for gains from bullish outlook on monthly expiry
items.description: Nifty’s seven-day winning streak signals bullish momentum, supported by strong base formation around the 24,000–24,200 range. Despite a spike in INDIA VIX, the index rebounded, closing near its high. Experts recommend a Bull Call Spread strategy for monthly expiry, targeting 24,500–24,800, with positive cues from PCR and max pain data.

items.title: Pakistan stock market falls 2% after India suspends Indus Waters Treaty over Pahalgam terror attack
items.description: The Pakistan Stock Exchange (PSX) dropped sharply after India imposed tough diplomatic measures in response to the Pahalgam terror attack. The KSE-100 index fell 2.12%, reflecting investor concern. Meanwhile, Indian markets showed resilience, despite geopolitical tensions and IMF's downgraded growth forecast for Pakistan.

items.title: Bajaj twins among 5 large and mid-cap stocks to hit all-time highs on Thursday
items.description: Indian benchmark indices edged lower on Thursday, snapping a seven-day rally, weighed down by losses in ICICI Bank, HUL, and Bharti Airtel. However, five large and mid-cap stocks from the Nifty500 index defied the trend to hit fresh all-time highs. Here's the list:

items.title: Moody’s expected to announce IndusInd Bank rating decision within 2 months
items.description: Moody's is scrutinizing IndusInd Bank's risk management and leadership transition, following revelations of accounting discrepancies in forex derivatives. The review, initiated last month, aims to assess the bank's capabilities, with a decision expected within 90 days. An external report highlighted a potential ₹1,979 crore negative impact as of June 30, 2024.

items.title: Opening the Gates: China eases foreign investment rules in 2025
items.description: The negative list outlines sectors in which foreign investment is either restricted or outright prohibited in China. First introduced in 2018, it serves as a guide for global investors to understand which industries are off-limits or require special permissions. The policy operates on the principle of “entry unless prohibited,” signaling that investment is generally welcome except where specifically restricted. (Source: Reuters)

items.title: Tesla’s Brand at a Crossroads: Can Musk Fix the Damage?
items.description: Elon Musk, often referred to as a "Moonshot Master" and the "Edison of Our Age," has built an empire with Tesla that has reshaped the automotive and tech industries. However, despite his visionary status, Tesla is grappling with a major issue: brand damage. Sales have dropped significantly, profits are down two-thirds, and global competitors are rapidly gaining market share. Musk’s personal and political views have become a central challenge for the company, leaving Tesla’s future uncertain. (Source: AP)

items.title: ​US-China Trade War: A Fair Deal in Sight?​
items.description: U.S. President Donald Trump expressed hope for a "fair deal" with China, indicating that discussions are ongoing. He described the situation as "active" and emphasised his good personal relationship with Chinese President Xi Jinping, suggesting that a breakthrough could be possible. (Source: AP)

items.title: Eternal shares slip 2% after food delivery biz CEO Rakesh Ranjan steps down
items.description: Eternal, Zomato's parent company, experienced a 1.7% stock dip following CEO Rakesh Ranjan's resignation, though he will remain in a different role. Founder Deepinder Goyal will temporarily oversee the food delivery vertical amid an internal reshuffle and broader sector slowdown. Concerns linger about Zomato's market share as competitors expand rapid delivery services, despite a modest GOV increase.

items.title: Syngene International shares slump 10% after Q4 profit dips despite revenue growth
items.description: Syngene International's shares plummeted 10% following a reported 3% year-on-year decline in consolidated net profit for Q4 FY25, despite an 11% increase in revenue. The company's EBITDA rose, but margins slightly decreased. Despite the dip, Syngene is optimistic about long-term growth, driven by its biologics CDMO business and research division, further supported by a recent acquisition in the US.

items.title: Jefferies’ Chris Wood says best over for US stocks, sees more losses
items.description: Jefferies strategist Christopher Wood warns that the U.S. market has peaked, forecasting further declines in equities, Treasury bonds, and the dollar. He urges investors to diversify into Chinese, Indian, and European assets. With U.S. valuations at extremes and global dominance shrinking, Wood sees a long-term shift favoring emerging markets, especially India, which remains under-owned globally.

items.title: UBS upgrades India to neutral but still favors China: 4 reasons why
items.description: UBS has strategically moved away from globally exposed markets, opting instead for those driven by local dynamics. Its revised scorecard favors economies with stable earnings, minimal vulnerability to global trade disruptions, and strong bottom-up analyst sentiment—making China and Indonesia key beneficiaries of this shift in capital allocation.

items.title: Bharti Airtel, BSE among 7 stocks that are near the buy point. Do you own any?
items.description: MarketSmith has a positive view on several stocks that it considers are near the buy point. These stocks include Bharti Airtel, BSE, PG Electroplast, Indian Hotels, and Cholamandalam Investment and Finance. Here is a list of 7 stocks that are near the buy point, as listed on MarketSmith:

items.title: Stocks to buy today: Nuvama sees 14% upside in LTIMindtree post Q4 results, raises target for Tata Consumer
items.description: Tata Consumer shares: Nuvama maintains a positive stance on Tata Consumer Products and LTIMindtree, with minor revisions to earnings forecasts and target prices.

items.title: Gold rush meets stock market bull run! Rare double boom squashing your portfolio plan?
items.description: India's stock and gold markets are simultaneously surging, defying traditional investment strategies. The Sensex and Nifty have soared, while gold prices have skyrocketed due to a weakening US dollar and global uncertainty. Experts advise investors to maintain a long-term asset allocation, stagger investments, and avoid chasing short-term highs, suggesting profit booking if gold holdings exceed 20-25% of the portfolio.

items.title: These 6 F&O stocks saw a high increase in futures open interest
items.description: As of April 22, there was a notable surge in futures open interest for six stocks in the NSE F&O pack, contributing to a total increase in open interest of over 10% as compared to the previous trade. A significant uptick in futures open interest signifies a substantial growth in the number of active, unexpired futures contracts in a specific security. This uptrend reflects an increasing number of participants either initiating new positions or expanding the size of their existing positions within the futures market.

items.title: Biocon shares fall 3% after board approves fundraise of up to Rs 4,500 crore
items.description: Biocon shares: The board approved a hike in the company’s authorised share capital from Rs 625 crore to Rs 700 crore, along with a corresponding amendment to the capital clause in its Memorandum of Association.
